title: Matt Agnew & Chelsie McLeod enjoy a date night amid rumours they'd split
text:
Fans have been vocal in their concern over Matt Agnew and Chelsie McLeod's seemingly distant relationship.

But on Thursday, the much-loved couple were all smiles on a romantic date night together, putting an end to the rumours that they'd split.

'Date night with this one,' Matt posted and joked 'the weekend starts on Thursday'.

Loved up! The Bachelor's Matt Agnew and Chelsie McLeod put split rumours to rest on Thursday by enjoying a romantic date night together

The picture of the happy couple was of great relief to their fans, many who said they were so glad to see the reality TV couple together again.

'This is where we ask if y’all are still dating,' one person said,

'In shock a program like Bachelor can work! Very happy for you both,' said another.

On Wednesday, the 32-year-old astrophysicist fueled break-up rumours as he was spotted looking downcast on his morning commute.

All smiles! The happy couple shared a black and white selfie of themselves smiling

Matt, who works for data analytics company Quantium in Melbourne's CBD, failed to raise a smile on his way to the office.

Matt dressed casually in a loose fitting shirt and jeans, which he paired with a brown leather jacket and white Adidas sneakers.

He was clean shaven and wore his trademark black spectacles while strolling towards his workplace on Bourke Street.

Still going strong! The couple, who met on The Bachelor, recently sparked some unfounded speculation that they may have split

Fans have expressed concern that Matt recently went on holiday without Chelsie, with one person asking her on Instagram: 'Why is Matt still not around?'

Chelsie also uploaded a picture of Matt sporting a new moustache but later deleted the post for an unknown reason.

But despite these fears, the 28-year-old chemical engineer has denied rumours their relationship is already on the rocks.

In response to a follower who asked about Matt's whereabouts, Chelsie explained he had flown to Dubai to catch up with his UK-based family.

Speculation: Fans have expressed concern that Matt recently went on holiday without Chelsie, with one person asking her on Instagram, 'Why is Matt still not around?

'Matt joined them on their holiday in Dubai, not that I really need to give a reason why,' Chelsie wrote.

'Now Matt has met his baby nephew, he'll be back in no time, I can assure you!'

The couple officially began their relationship after the Bachelor finale, which was filmed earlier this year and aired on September 19.
description: Fans have been vocal in their concern over Matt Agnew and Chelsie McLeod's seemingly distant relationship.
authors: Tom Place For Daily Mail Australia
